Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: vertical strokes at rim above broken maeander band; below, row of dots above tall broken meanders.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos the sherd is in the Mature Animal Style. The lack of interior decoration and the metopal decoration in the form of the large maeander pattern are all typical of the Wild Goat Style, thus suggesting that the sherd is slightly earlier.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 262, no. 532)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0116) (phase 2)
